Christ, to live not unto themselves but unto Him who died for them...

Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to hear the call to offer
myself for whole-hearted surrender to live entirely for Christ...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"Christ redeemed us from the curse of the law;
having become a curse for us." (Gal. 3:13)

Our Lesson for Today:

Scripture teaches us that there are two points of view from which we
may regard Christ's death upon the cross...

The one is the redemption of the cross: Christ dying for us as our 
complete deliverance from the curse of sin. (The other)

The fellowship of the cross: Christ taking us up to die with Him and
making us partakers of the fellowship of His death in our own experience...

In our text we have three great unreachable thoughts:
The law of God has pronounced a curse on all sin and on all that is sinful.
Christ took our curse upon Himself ~ He became a curse and so destroyed 
its power. (and)
In that cross we now have the everlasting redemption from sin and all its
power...

The cross reveals to us man's sin as under the curse, Christ becoming a
curse and so overcoming it, and our full and everlasting deliverance from 
the curse...

In these thoughts the lost and most hopeless sinner finds a sure ground
of confidence and of hope...

Prayer Suggestion:
Heavenly Father, I praise You for the redemption of the cross!

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

"Have this in mind in you, which was also in Christ Jesus."
(Phil. 2:5)

the form of a servant; He humbled Himself, even to death on the cross...

it will lead to a deeper comprehension and a higher appreciation of the
redemption of the cross through the personal experience of the fellowship
of the cross...

Dear Heavenly Father, may I gain a higher appreciation of
the redemption of the cross through the personal experience
of the fellowship of the cross...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"I have been crucified with Christ; yet I live; and yet
no longer I, but Christ liveth in me." (Gal. 2:20)

Our Lesson for Today:

To often the thought of fellowship with Christ in His bearing
the cross, has led to a vain attempt in our own power to follow
Him and bear His image...

but it is impossible until we first learn to know something of
what it means to say, "I have been crucified with Christ."

Let us try to understand this. When Adam died, all his descendents 
died with him and in him. In his sin in paradise and in the spiritual
death into which he fell, we had a share; we died with him...

The power of that sin and death, in which all his descendents share, 
works in every child of Adam every day...

Now Christ came as the second Adam. In His death on the cross, 
all who believe in Him had a share. Each of us may say in truth,
"I have been crucified with Christ."

As the representative of His people, He took us up with Him on the
cross, Yes you and me too. The life that He gives is the crucified
life in which He entered heaven and was exalted to the throne,
standing as a Lamb as it had been slain...

The power of His death and life work in us, and as we hold fast to
that truth that we have been crucified with Him, we now live no more 
but Christ liveth in us ~ in this power we will conquer sin...

The life that we have received from Him is a life that has been
made free from the power of sin...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I long in every deed to be dead to all sin, so that
the union of Your Son crucified and in fellowship of His cross
can day by day it become my life...

the acceptance of the Holy Spirit...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"They that are in Christ Jesus have crucified the flesh
with the passions and the lusts thereof." (Gal. 5:24)

Our Lesson for Today:

Of the flesh Paul teaches us (Ro. 7:18), in me, that is, in the flesh,
dwelleth no good thing." and again (Ro. 8:7), "The mind of the flesh
is, enmity against God; for it is not subject to the law of God, neither 
indeed can it be."

When Adam lost the Spirit of God, he became flesh, [Flesh] is the
expression for the evil, corrupt nature that we inherit from Adam...

[Of this flesh it is written] "Our old man was crucified with Him." (Ro. 7:6)
And Paul puts it more strongly when he says, "They that are in Christ Jesus
have crucified the flesh."

When the disciples heard and obeyed the call of Jesus to follow Him,
they honestly meant to do so, but as Jesus later on taught them what that 
would imply, they were far from being ready to yield immediately...

Yes even so those who are Christ's and have accepted Him as the
Crucified One do not really understand what that includes. But by
the act of surrender they have actually crucified the flesh and have
consented to regard it as an accursed thing, nailed to the cross with
Christ...

Paul taught the Galatians, "Walk in the Spirit, and you shall not fulfill
the lusts of the flesh."

"As many as are led by the Spirit of God, they are the children of God."

And yes, only the Spirit, can guide us in living faith and fellowship with 
Christ as the flesh is kept in the place of crucifixion...

Prayer Suggestion:
O Lord, how little I understood when I accepted you in faith
that I crucified once for all the flesh with its passions and lusts!
I ask You humbly, teach me to believe and so to live in You,
the Crucified One, that I like Paul may always glory in the cross
on which the world and the flesh are crucified. ~~~

06/08/09~~~food for thought~~~Nothing lies beyond the power of man if
it lies within the will of God...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"Far be it from me to glory. save in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ,
through which the world hath been crucified unto me, and I unto the
world." (Gal. 6:14)

Our Lesson for Today:

Here Paul speaks of his only glory being that in Christ, he has in every
deed been crucified to the world and entirely delivered from its power...

When he said: "I have been crucified with Christ," it was not only an
inner spiritual truth, but an actual, practical experience in relation to the 
world and its temptations...

Paul boasts that he lives as one crucified to the world, and that now the 
world as a powerless enemy was crucified to him. It was this that made
him glory in the cross of Christ...

O Christian friends, when the world crucified Christ, it crucified you with Him.
When Christ overcame the world on the cross, he made you an overcomer too...

He calls you now, at whatever cost of self-denial, to regard the world in its
hostility to God and His Kingdom as a crucified enemy over whom the cross
can ever keep you conqueror...

What a different relationship to the pleasures and attractions of the world
the Christian has who by the Holy Spirit has learned to say: "I have been
crucified with Christ; the crucified Christ liveth in me"!

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that Your Holy Spirit may be revealed
to us in all His power, teaching us what it means to "glory in the cross 
of our Lord Jesus Christ, through which the world has been crucified 
unto me."

partakers of His victory...

06/10/09~~~food for thought~~~Death to self is to be the Christian watchword...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Then Jesus said to His disciples, "If any one wishes to come after Me,
let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow Me...(Mt. 16:24)

Our Lesson for Today:

Christ had for the first time definitely announced that He would have to suffer
much and be killed and be raised again."Peter rebuked Him, saying, 'Be it
far from Thee, Lord: this shall never be unto Thee."

Christ's answer was, "Get thee behind Me Satan." The spirit of Peter, seeking
to turn Him away from the cross and its suffering, was nothing but Satan tempting 
Him to turn aside from the path which God had appointed as our way of salvation...

Instead of denying himself, Peter denied his Lord: "I know not the man." When
a man learns to obey Christ's command, he says of himself: "I know not the man."

This is the secret of true discipleship, to bear the cross, to acknowledge the
death sentence that has been passed on self, and to deny any right that self

Our Bible Verses for Today:
Therefore, brothers, since we have confidence to enter the Most Holy

through the curtain, that is, His body (Heb. 10:19-20)

Our Lesson for Today:
In the temple there was a veil between the holy place and the most holy.
At the altar in the court the blood of the sacrifice was sprinkled for the
forgiveness of sins...

That gave the priests entrance into the holy place to offer God the incense 
as part of a holy worship. But into the Most Holy, behind the veil, the High 
Priest alone might enter once a year...

That veil was the type of sinful nature; even though it had received the 
forgiveness of sin, full access and fellowship with God was impossible...

When Christ died, the veil was rent. Christ dedicated a new and living way
to God through the rent veil of His flesh. This new way, by which we now 
can enter into the holiest of all, ever passes through the rent veil of the flesh...

Every believer "has crucified the flesh with the passions and the lusts thereof." 
(Gal. 5:24)

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Heavenly Father, help us to praise Thee that the Holy Spirit
ever dwells in us to keep the flesh in its place of crucifixion and
condemnation and to give us the abiding victory over all temptation...

Let us run with patience the race that is set before us,
looking unto Jesus, the Author and Perfector of our
faith, who for the joy that was set before Him endured

set upon the goal and the prize...

life we are to be led by the Spirit, this will lead to the throne (the goal) 
and the glory of God...(the prize)

the flesh...

that God so highly exalted Him, so let us walk in His footsteps bearing 
our cross after Him with the flesh condemned and crucified...

As believers let us awake to His blessed truth and run the race 
always looking to the crucified Jesus, and we will receive power
to win for Christ the souls He has purchased on the cross...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help us to fix our eyes on Jesus 
enduring the cross as the one object of our desire...

06/29/09~~~food for thought~~~Where would we be without the sacrifice of Christ?

Our Bible Verses for Today:
Under the system of the Jewish laws, the high priest brought
the blood of animals into the Holy Place as a sacrifice for sin,
but the bodies of the animals were burned outside the camp...

So also Jesus suffered and died outside the city gates in order
to make His people holy by shedding His blood...

So let us go out to Him outside the camp and bear the disgrace 
He bore...(Heb. 13:11-13)

Our Lesson for Today:
There are many Christians who love to hear of the boldness with
which we can enter into the Holy Place through His blood, who yet
have little desire for the fellowship of His reproach and are unwilling 
to separate themselves from the world with the same boldness with
which they think to enter the sanctuary...

Christians suffer inconceivable loss when they think of entering into 
the Holy Place in faith and prayer and then feel themselves free to 
enjoy the friendship of the world so long as they do nothing actually 
sinful...

But the Word of God has said: "Know ye not that the friendship of
the world is enmity against God?" "Love not the world, neither the
things that are in the world; if any man loves the world, the love of
the Father is not in Him." "Be not conformed to this world."

To be a follower of Christ means to be like Him in His love of the cross
and His will to sacrifice self that the Father may be glorified and others
may be saved...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Heavenly Father, teach me what it means that I am called
to follow You outside the camp, bearing Your reproach, and so 
to bear witness to Your holy redeeming love. Let the Spirit and 
the love that was in You be in me too, that I may at any cost seek 
to win the souls for whom You have died...

07/01/09~~~food for thought~~~Look up the Hymn, "Living for Jesus"
and read it through...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
He Himself bore our sins in His body on the tree, 
so that we might die to sins and live for righteousness;
by His wounds you have been healed...(1 Pet. 2:24)

Our Lesson for Today:
We need to remember daily what it cost Jesus to bear the cost
of the cross. We merely have to remember some of His last words,
like when He cried ~

"Now is my soul troubled, and what shall I say? Father, save 
Me from this hour. But for this cause came I unto this hour."

Let us not imagine that the fellowship of the cross of which Peter
speaks here, "That we, having died to sins, might live unto 
righteousness," is easily understood or experienced...

It means that we have to be willing to allow the Holy Spirit to teach 
us what it is to be identified with Christ in His cross...

It means that we will have to realize by faith how actually we shared 
with Christ in His death and now, as He lives in us, must live in an unceasing 
fellowship with Him, the Crucified One...

This costs self-sacrifice; it costs earnest prayer; it costs a wholehearted surrender to God and His will and the cross of Jesus; it
costs living in Christ and unceasing fellowship with Him...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Heavenly Father, help me to discover fully what it means to
live day by day the secret of living a life in and for You...

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
